channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scoop: U.S. pushing to finalize plan for international Gaza security force

item.title: The ACA premium surge hits home
item.description: The anticipated spike in Affordable Care Act premiums came into focus this week as previews of 2026 coverage options showed how customers could be on ...

item.title: Trump cuts China tariffs after promises from Xi on rare earths, soybeans
item.description: President Trump said following his meeting with Chinese leader Xi Jinping in South Korea that he had agreed to cut tariffs on China in exchange for co...

item.title: Bill Gates' pivot on climate change escalates debate with scientists
item.description: Bill Gates' shift from "doomsday" climate warnings to a focus on improving human lives is triggering sharp reactions from scientists and activists. Wh...

item.title: Map: Where daylight saving time could become permanent
item.description: Data: NCSL ; Map: Axios Visuals Most of the U.S. will fall back to standard time Sunday — even as most of the country wants to sunset the biannual clo...

item.title: He’s gay, Republican and running for statewide office. It’s complicated.
item.description: If John Reid becomes Virginia lieutenant governor, he’d be the most prominent gay Republican in elected office. Not everyone in his party is comfortab...

item.title: Trump directs Pentagon to test nuclear weapons for first time since 1992
item.description: The president said he wanted testing to occur “on an equal basis” with Russia and China, just before he met his Chinese counterpart for high-stakes tr...

item.title: Trump cuts tariffs on China after ‘truly great’ meeting with Xi
item.description: China’s leader agreed to delay restrictions on rare earth minerals for a year and buy more soybeans, Trump said after a meeting designed to calm trade...

item.title: Most Americans oppose East Wing demolition for Trump ballroom, poll finds
item.description: Fifty-six percent say they oppose President Donald Trump’s decision to tear down part of the White House to build a 90,000-square-foot ballroom buildi...

item.title: A decade of dramatic GOP change since Paul Ryan became speaker
item.description: Ten years after Ryan’s ascension, there’s little of the former speaker’s traditional conservatism remaining in today’s House Republican caucus.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
